creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: one of a pair tobacco leaf pattern
medium: Porcelain with enamel and gilded decoration
text: The "Tobacco Leaf" decoration seen on this plate was possibly one of the last Chinese flower designs to emerge in the late eighteenth century. It was employed as an allover design on objects from dinner services to chamber sets. The leaf may actually be that of a tropical plant from southern Asia.
title: Plate, one of a pair
